description:
Ironic will fail sometimes to clear the node's instance_uuid
even when the instance is deleted on the nova side.

The ironic virt driver should be more tolerant in this case.
Instead of rasing exception, it can LOG warning the failed
instances.

the problem code is at https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py#L475
title: ironic driver is raising exception when some of node's instance cannot be found

comments.content:
Ironic will fail sometimes to clear the node's instance_uuid
even when the instance is deleted on the nova side.

The ironic virt driver should be more tolerant in this case.
Instead of rasing exception, it can LOG warning the failed
instances.

the problem code is at https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/ironic/driver.py#L475
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gongysh

comments.content:

comments.content:
Change abandoned by Michael Still (<email address hidden>) on branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/322262
Reason: This patch has been sitting unchanged for more than 12 weeks. I am therefore going to abandon it to keep the nova review queue sane. Please feel free to restore the change if you're still working on it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content: There are no currently open reviews on this bug, changing the status back to the previous state and unassigning. If there are active reviews related to this bug, please include links in comments.
